H0.text: Resistor is a good metal pan that will heat up quickly when placed over a gas or electric burner.

H1.text: Insulator is a material that is claimed in the question to be a good explanation for why a metal pan heats up quickly when placed over a gas or electric burner.

H2.text: Conductor is what a metal pan is, because it will heat up quickly when placed over a gas or electric burner.

H3.text: Accelerator is a good metal pan that heats up quickly when placed over a gas or electric burner.

A4.text: Metals have this high thermal conductivity due to free electrons facilitating heat transfer.

A5.text: Now, as they had been all dipt alike at the same time in the same oil, it must follow, that the wire, upon which the wax had been melted the highest, had been the best conductor of heat.
